title: Matthew Chapter 26 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 26 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 26 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 26.

questions.question: Who was the high priest mentioned in Matthew 26 that the chief priests and elders assembled with?
questions.correctAnswer: Caiaphas
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:3 states that the chief priests, scribes, and elders assembled at the palace of the high priest called Caiaphas.

questions.question: What did the woman pour on Jesus' head in Bethany?
questions.correctAnswer: Alabaster box of precious ointment
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:7 records a woman pouring ointment from an alabaster box on Jesus' head as he sat at meat.

questions.question: How much money did Judas Iscariot covetantly agree to betray Jesus for?
questions.correctAnswer: Thirty pieces of silver
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:15 states Judas asked what they would give him, and they covenanted for thirty pieces of silver.

questions.question: Where did Jesus say he would eat the Passover with his disciples?
options: At the house of a certain man in the city
questions.correctAnswer: At the house of a certain man in the city
questions.explanation: In Matthew 26:18, Jesus instructs the disciples to prepare the Passover at the house of a certain man in the city.

questions.question: What did Jesus say the bread represented during the Passover meal?
questions.correctAnswer: His body
questions.explanation: According to Matthew 26:26, Jesus took bread, blessed it, broke it, and said it was his body.

questions.question: What did Jesus say the cup represented during the Passover meal?
options: His blood of the new testament
questions.correctAnswer: His blood of the new testament
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:28 states that the cup is his blood of the new testament, shed for many for remission of sins.

questions.question: Where did Jesus and the disciples go after singing a hymn at the Passover meal?
questions.correctAnswer: Mount of Olives
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:30 records that after singing a hymn, Jesus and the disciples went out to the Mount of Olives.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say would deny him thrice before the cock crowed?
questions.correctAnswer: Peter
questions.explanation: Jesus tells Peter in Matthew 26:34 that he will deny Him three times before the cock crows.

questions.question: What did Jesus ask the disciples to do while He prayed in Gethsemane?
questions.correctAnswer: Sit and watch
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:36-38 records Jesus asking the disciples to sit while He prayed and to watch with Him.

questions.question: How many times did Jesus pray the same prayer in Gethsemane before His arrest?
questions.correctAnswer: Three times
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:39-44 shows Jesus praying the same prayer three times before His arrest.

questions.question: True or False: Judas gave a sign to identify Jesus by kissing Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:48 states Judas gave a sign by saying 'Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is he'.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus rebuked the disciple who drew a sword and struck the servant of the high priest.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Matthew 26:52, Jesus tells the disciple to put up the sword, saying those who take the sword will perish by it.

questions.question: True or False: All the disciples stayed with Jesus during His arrest.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:56 records that all the disciples forsook Jesus and fled at His arrest.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'The Son of man is betrayed into the hands of ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: sinners
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:45 records Jesus saying the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: thrice
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:34 and 26:75 both affirm Peter will deny Jesus thrice before the cock crows.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 26 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 26 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is feeling discouraged because they see others wasting resources on what seems unnecessary. Based on Matthew 26, what biblical truth would you share about generosity and honoring Jesus?
options: True generosity honors Jesus even if others think it is wasteful
It is better to save resources than to spend on honoring Jesus
Only give to the poor, never on personal devotion
Jesus prefers practical gifts over symbolic acts
questions.correctAnswer: True generosity honors Jesus even if others think it is wasteful
questions.explanation: In Matthew 26:7-13, a woman pours precious ointment on Jesus, which the disciples thought was wasteful, but Jesus explains it as a good work done for His burial and worthy of remembrance. This teaches that honoring Jesus with our resources, even if misunderstood, is true generosity.

questions.question: How does Matthew 26 teach us about integrity and honesty in daily life through Judas Iscariot's actions?
options: Betraying for money shows lack of integrity and leads to ruin
It is acceptable to betray if pressured
Loyalty can be bought with gifts
Dishonest actions have no real consequences
questions.correctAnswer: Betraying for money shows lack of integrity and leads to ruin
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:14-16 shows Judas agreeing to betray Jesus for thirty pieces of silver, highlighting how lack of integrity and greed can lead to grave consequences. This warns believers to maintain honesty and faithfulness.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with temptation to deny their faith in difficult times. Based on Peter’s experience in Matthew 26, what counsel would you offer?
options: Even the strongest can fail, so watch and pray to resist temptation
Denying faith is acceptable if afraid
Avoid all fellowship to not face temptation
Strength comes without prayer or vigilance
questions.correctAnswer: Even the strongest can fail, so watch and pray to resist temptation
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:33-35 and 40-41 show Peter’s denial despite his confidence, and Jesus’ instruction to watch and pray because the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak. This teaches the importance of prayer and vigilance to persevere through trials.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ prayer in Gethsemane teach us about humility and submission to God’s will in times of trial?
options: True humility submits to God's will even when the trial is hard
One should only pray if the trial is easy
Avoid submitting if you dislike the outcome
God’s will is optional in difficult times
questions.correctAnswer: True humility submits to God's will even when the trial is hard
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:39, 42, and 44 show Jesus praying for the cup to pass from Him but ultimately submitting to the Father’s will. This models humility and trust in God’s plan despite personal suffering.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ institution of the Lord’s Supper in Matthew 26 teach about spiritual discipline and remembrance?
options: Regularly remembering Jesus’ sacrifice strengthens faith and fellowship
The Lord’s Supper is a casual meal without significance
Only leaders should partake in communion
It is optional to remember Jesus’ sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Regularly remembering Jesus’ sacrifice strengthens faith and fellowship
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:26-28 records Jesus instituting the Lord’s Supper as a memorial of His body and blood shed for remission of sins, emphasizing the importance of spiritual discipline and communal remembrance in the church.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to remain faithful when facing rejection by friends. What does Matthew 26 teach about perseverance in such trials?
options: Jesus was forsaken by His disciples but fulfilled Scripture, so trust God’s plan
Rejection means God has abandoned you
Avoid trials to keep faith safe
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus was forsaken by His disciples but fulfilled Scripture, so trust God’s plan
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:56 shows all disciples forsook Jesus and fled, yet this was to fulfill prophecy. This encourages believers to trust God’s sovereign plan even when isolated or rejected.

questions.question: What biblical truth about prayer and watchfulness can we learn from Jesus finding His disciples asleep in the garden?
options: Prayer and vigilance are essential because the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
Sleeping during trials is acceptable and expected
Prayer alone is enough without watchfulness
Physical weakness excuses lack of spiritual effort
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and vigilance are essential because the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:40-41 records Jesus rebuking His disciples for sleeping and instructing them to watch and pray so they do not enter temptation, teaching the necessity of active spiritual discipline.

questions.question: Based on Jesus’ prediction of Peter’s denial, what practical lesson about humility and self-awareness can believers apply?
options: We should not be overconfident about our spiritual strength but rely on God
Denying Christ is inevitable and acceptable
Boasting about faith protects from failure
questions.correctAnswer: We should not be overconfident about our spiritual strength but rely on God
questions.explanation: In Matthew 26:33-35 and 69-75, Peter confidently claims he will not deny Jesus but ends up denying Him thrice, reminding believers to be humble and depend on God’s strength.

questions.question: How does Matthew 26 illustrate the importance of sharing the gospel and the legacy of good works in evangelism?
options: The woman’s act of anointing Jesus will be told wherever the gospel is preached
Good deeds are private and should not be shared
Evangelism depends only on words, not actions
questions.correctAnswer: The woman’s act of anointing Jesus will be told wherever the gospel is preached
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:13 states that the woman’s act will be remembered as a memorial wherever the gospel is preached, showing how acts of faith support evangelism and testimony.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus taught that the poor will always be present, so honoring Him with special acts is sometimes necessary and right.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Matthew 26:11, Jesus says, 'For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always,' indicating that special acts of honoring Him, like the woman’s anointing, are appropriate at times.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus rebuked the use of the sword during His arrest and taught that those who live by the sword will perish by it.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:51-52 records Jesus telling His disciple to put the sword away because all who take the sword will perish by it, teaching non-violence and trust in God’s plan.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, "Take, eat; this is my ______."
questions.correctAnswer: body
questions.explanation: In Matthew 26:26, Jesus took bread, blessed it, broke it, and said, 'Take, eat; this is my body,' instituting the Lord’s Supper as a remembrance of His sacrifice.

questions.question: How does Matthew 26 demonstrate the importance of obedience and preparation in serving the Lord?
options: The disciples prepared the Passover as Jesus directed, showing obedient service
Preparation is unnecessary if you have good intentions
Only leaders should prepare for the Lord’s work
Obedience can be delayed without consequence
questions.correctAnswer: The disciples prepared the Passover as Jesus directed, showing obedient service
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:17-19 shows the disciples asking where to prepare the Passover and following Jesus’ instructions exactly, exemplifying faithful obedience and readiness in serving God.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ calm response during His arrest teach us about integrity and trust in God amid persecution?
options: Jesus trusted God’s plan and did not resist violently despite wrongful arrest
It is right to fight back physically when persecuted
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus trusted God’s plan and did not resist violently despite wrongful arrest
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:55-56 shows Jesus questioning those who came to arrest Him and submitting to God’s will, modeling trust and integrity under persecution.

questions.question: A believer feels overwhelmed by sorrow and asks how to respond. What example from Matthew 26 can guide them in prayer and seeking God’s strength?
options: Jesus in Gethsemane showed deep sorrow but prayed persistently, submitting to God’s will
Sorrow means lack of faith and should be ignored
Prayer is only for joyful times
One should face sorrow alone without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus in Gethsemane showed deep sorrow but prayed persistently, submitting to God’s will
questions.explanation: Matthew 26:36-38, 39-44 depict Jesus deeply sorrowful yet praying multiple times and submitting to God’s will, teaching believers to bring their burdens to God in prayer.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 26 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 26.

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophecy is alluded to in Jesus' statement about the shepherd being smitten and the sheep being scattered?
questions.correctAnswer: Zechariah 13:7
questions.explanation: Jesus refers to the prophecy in Zechariah 13:7 when he says, 'I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad' (Matthew 26:31), foreshadowing his arrest and the disciples' scattering.

questions.question: What is the significance of the woman pouring ointment on Jesus' head, as explained by Jesus himself?
options: It was an act of preparation for burial
It was a symbol of kingship
It was a sign of repentance
questions.correctAnswer: It was an act of preparation for burial
questions.explanation: Jesus explains that the woman's act of pouring ointment was for his burial (Matthew 26:12), indicating a typological foreshadowing of his death and burial.

questions.question: How does Judas Iscariot's betrayal relate to Old Testament imagery and Hebrew concepts of covenant betrayal?
options: He delivers Jesus for thirty pieces of silver, reminiscent of the price of a slave (Exodus 21:32)
He anoints Jesus as a king
He hides Jesus from the priests
questions.correctAnswer: He delivers Jesus for thirty pieces of silver, reminiscent of the price of a slave (Exodus 21:32)
questions.explanation: Judas' acceptance of thirty pieces of silver to betray Jesus recalls the price set for a slave in Exodus 21:32, symbolizing a profound betrayal of covenant loyalty (Matthew 26:15).

questions.question: What literary device is used in Jesus' declaration during the Last Supper, 'This is my body' and 'This is my blood'?
questions.correctAnswer: Metonymy
questions.explanation: Jesus uses metonymy by referring to bread and wine as his body and blood respectively (Matthew 26:26-28), symbolizing his impending sacrifice.

questions.question: What is the Greek term translated as 'new testament' in Matthew 26:28, and what is its theological significance?
options: Diathēkē, indicating a covenant established by Jesus' blood
questions.correctAnswer: Diathēkē, indicating a covenant established by Jesus' blood
questions.explanation: 'Diathēkē' means covenant or testament, highlighting Jesus establishing a new covenant through his sacrificial blood for the remission of sins (Matthew 26:28).

questions.question: In the context of Matthew 26, how is the Mount of Olives significant historically and theologically?
options: It is the site of Jesus' prayer and betrayal, connecting to Messianic expectations
It is where Jesus performed miracles
It is where Jesus was born
It is the place where Jesus preached the Sermon on the Mount
questions.correctAnswer: It is the site of Jesus' prayer and betrayal, connecting to Messianic expectations
questions.explanation: The Mount of Olives is historically and theologically important as the place where Jesus prayed in agony and was betrayed (Matthew 26:30, 36-46), fulfilling Messianic prophecies and symbolizing his submission to God's will.

questions.question: Which theme in Matthew 26 is foreshadowed by Jesus' repeated prayers in Gethsemane?
options: Submission to divine will despite suffering
questions.correctAnswer: Submission to divine will despite suffering
questions.explanation: Jesus prays three times asking if the cup may pass from him but ultimately submits to God's will (Matthew 26:39, 42, 44), foreshadowing his obedient sacrifice.

questions.question: What is the significance of Peter's denial and the crowing of the cock in Matthew 26?
options: It fulfills Jesus' prophecy and symbolizes human weakness under pressure
It marks the beginning of Jesus' ministry
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfills Jesus' prophecy and symbolizes human weakness under pressure
questions.explanation: Peter denies Jesus three times before the cock crows, fulfilling Jesus' prediction (Matthew 26:34, 74-75) and illustrating the frailty and failure of discipleship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 26, Jesus rebuked the disciple who used a sword during his arrest, emphasizing peace over violence.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus told the disciple to put away his sword, saying 'all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword' (Matthew 26:52), highlighting nonviolence.

questions.question: What is the irony presented in the chief priests and elders arresting Jesus at night with swords and staves, as Jesus points out?
options: They treat him like a thief despite his daily teaching in the temple
They honor him as a king
They invite him to a festival
questions.correctAnswer: They treat him like a thief despite his daily teaching in the temple
questions.explanation: Jesus questions why they come with weapons to arrest him as a thief when he taught openly daily in the temple (Matthew 26:55), highlighting the injustice and false accusation.

questions.question: How does the narrative structure in Matthew 26 emphasize Judas' betrayal?
options: By introducing Judas early and repeatedly highlighting his seeking opportunity to betray Jesus
By focusing on Peter's denial only
By describing Judas as an innocent bystander
questions.correctAnswer: By introducing Judas early and repeatedly highlighting his seeking opportunity to betray Jesus
questions.explanation: The chapter introduces Judas' betrayal as early as verse 14 and notes his seeking opportunity to betray Jesus (Matthew 26:14,16), structurally foregrounding the theme of betrayal.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Jesus saying, 'The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak' in Matthew 26:41?
options: It acknowledges human weakness and the need for vigilance in prayer
It denies the importance of prayer
It suggests that the disciples are perfect
It indicates that Jesus will not suffer
questions.correctAnswer: It acknowledges human weakness and the need for vigilance in prayer
questions.explanation: Jesus recognizes the disciples' good intentions but their susceptibility to failure, emphasizing the need to watch and pray to avoid temptation (Matthew 26:41).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus says, 'For this is my blood of the __________, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.'
questions.correctAnswer: new testament
questions.explanation: Jesus declares the cup as his blood of the new testament, establishing a new covenant for forgiveness of sins (Matthew 26:28).

questions.question: Which term best describes Judas' action in Matthew 26 when he identifies Jesus to the arresting party with a kiss?
questions.correctAnswer: Betrayal
questions.explanation: Judas uses a kiss, a sign of friendship, ironically as a signal to betray Jesus to the authorities (Matthew 26:48-49).

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'before the cock crow' in Peter's denial account?
options: It marks the time limit of Peter's denial prophecy
It refers to a rooster used in sacrifices
It indicates the beginning of the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the time limit of Peter's denial prophecy
questions.explanation: Jesus predicts Peter will deny him three times before the cock crows, marking the fulfillment time of his prophecy (Matthew 26:34, 74).

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 26 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 26 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What did Jesus predict would happen to the Son of Man after two days?
options: He would be betrayed to be crucified
questions.correctAnswer: He would be betrayed to be crucified
questions.explanation: Jesus clearly foretold His betrayal and crucifixion, which aligns with prophecies such as Isaiah 53:3-6 and Psalm 22, fulfilling the Messianic suffering servant role (Matthew 26:2).

questions.question: Who assembled to plan the capture and killing of Jesus?
options: The chief priests, scribes, and elders
questions.correctAnswer: The chief priests, scribes, and elders
questions.explanation: The Jewish religious leaders, specifically the chief priests, scribes, and elders, conspired to kill Jesus, reflecting opposition to the Messiah prophesied in Daniel 9:26 and Zechariah 13:7 (Matthew 26:3-4).

questions.question: Why did the religious leaders decide not to arrest Jesus during the feast?
options: Because Jesus was protected by the people
Because they feared a Roman backlash
Because they did not want an uproar among the people
Because they were waiting for a sign
questions.correctAnswer: Because they did not want an uproar among the people
questions.explanation: The leaders feared public unrest during the feast, showing their concern for maintaining order rather than justice, contrasting God's sovereign plan for Jesus' death (Matthew 26:5).

questions.question: What did the woman pour on Jesus as a preparation for His burial?
options: Alabaster box of very precious ointment
questions.correctAnswer: Alabaster box of very precious ointment
questions.explanation: The woman anointed Jesus with expensive ointment signifying His impending death and burial, fulfilling the symbolism of anointing the Messiah (Matthew 26:7, 12). This points to Psalm 23:5 and John 12:3.

questions.question: What was Jesus' response to the disciples' indignation over the ointment?
options: He said the ointment was wasted
He said she had done a good work upon Him
He told them to give it to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: He said she had done a good work upon Him
questions.explanation: Jesus affirmed the woman's act as a preparation for His burial, emphasizing the uniqueness of the moment and God's plan for salvation (Matthew 26:10-12). This reflects Old Testament burial customs in Isaiah 53:9.

questions.question: How much did Judas Iscariot agree to receive for betraying Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Thirty pieces of silver
questions.explanation: Judas' betrayal for thirty pieces of silver fulfills the prophecy of Zechariah 11:12-13, highlighting the fulfillment of Scripture in the Messiah’s suffering (Matthew 26:15).

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the one who would betray Him during the Last Supper?
options: That it would be better if he had never been born
That he would be honored among men
questions.correctAnswer: That it would be better if he had never been born
questions.explanation: Jesus pronounced a woe upon His betrayer, indicating the gravity of sin and judgment, consistent with the seriousness of rejecting the Messiah (Matthew 26:24). This aligns with Judas’ tragic end in Acts 1:18.

questions.question: What theological significance does Jesus attach to the bread He broke at the Last Supper?
options: It symbolizes the manna in the wilderness
It is merely a cultural practice
It signifies the law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: It represents His body
questions.explanation: Jesus identifies the bread as His body given for believers, instituting the New Covenant and prefiguring His sacrificial death (Matthew 26:26). This is foundational for understanding atonement and communion (Luke 22:19, 1 Corinthians 11:24).

questions.question: What does Jesus say the cup represents at the Last Supper?
options: The blood of the new testament for the remission of sins
The fruit of the vine as a blessing
questions.correctAnswer: The blood of the new testament for the remission of sins
questions.explanation: Jesus explains the cup as His blood of the new covenant, shed for many for forgiveness, revealing the heart of salvation theology (Matthew 26:28). This connects to Jeremiah 31:31-34 and Hebrews 9:15.

questions.question: What did Jesus say would happen to His disciples after He was smitten, according to prophecy?
questions.correctAnswer: They would be scattered
questions.explanation: Jesus quoted Zechariah 13:7 predicting that the shepherd would be struck and the sheep scattered, illustrating the disciples’ forthcoming desertion (Matthew 26:31). This highlights human weakness and fulfillment of prophecy.

questions.question: How did Peter respond when Jesus predicted his denial?
questions.correctAnswer: He denied it vehemently
questions.explanation: Peter confidently denied he would deny Jesus, demonstrating human pride and weakness, which was later fulfilled (Matthew 26:33-35). This is echoed in Luke 22:33-34 and John 13:38.

questions.question: What was Jesus' attitude and action in the Garden of Gethsemane?
options: He prayed earnestly, submitting to the Father's will
questions.correctAnswer: He prayed earnestly, submitting to the Father's will
questions.explanation: Jesus prayed three times, expressing sorrow and submission to God's will, illustrating His obedience and the weight of atonement (Matthew 26:36-44). This aligns with Philippians 2:8 and Hebrews 5:7.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the spirit and the flesh regarding temptation?
options: The spirit is weak but the flesh is willing
Both spirit and flesh are weak
The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
Both spirit and flesh are willing
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
questions.explanation: Jesus acknowledged the conflict between spiritual desire and human weakness, highlighting the need for vigilance and prayer (Matthew 26:41). This theme is consistent with Romans 7:18 and Galatians 5:17.

questions.question: What sign did Judas give to identify Jesus to the arresting party?
questions.correctAnswer: A kiss
questions.explanation: Judas gave a kiss as the sign to betray Jesus, an act of hypocrisy fulfilling Psalm 41:9 and emphasizing the theme of betrayal by a close associate (Matthew 26:48-49).

questions.question: How did Jesus respond to the violent defense by one of His companions?
options: He told him to put away his sword
questions.correctAnswer: He told him to put away his sword
questions.explanation: Jesus rebuked the use of violence, emphasizing peace and fulfillment of Scripture, teaching that God's kingdom is not advanced by force (Matthew 26:52-54). This aligns with Isaiah 53:7 and John 18:11.
